qas.question: What party's candidates were murdered in the September 30 elections?
How many members were from opposition parties?
How many total members were there?
Who was elected to be Chairman in May?

context: Following the hardliners' takeover, the September 30, 1990 elections (runoffs on October 14) were characterized by intimidation; several <a0_0>Popular Front<a0_0/> candidates were jailed, two were murdered, and unabashed ballot stuffing took place even in the presence of Western observers. The election results reflected the threatening environment; out of the <a2_0>350<a2_0/> members, 280 were Communists, with only <a1_0>45<a1_0/> opposition candidates from the Popular Front and other non-communist groups, who together formed a Democratic Bloc ("Dembloc"). In May 1990 <a3_0>Mutalibov<a3_0/> was elected Chairman of the Supreme Soviet unopposed.
